channel.title: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today
channel.description:
Hi everyone. A simple discussion really. I'm just about to start an Open University course, "Object-oriented programming with Java (Level 2)" in October.
I believe this will give me the fundamental foundations needed to really excel in programming, as it'll be my first official qualification.
I've messed about with private servers for about 4 years now, so I know some basics, but only what's associated with RuneScape private servers. I find it harder to put Java in to pratice outside of the RSPS environment because it's what I'm used to.
So, have you taken any college or university courses in programming? Are you self-taught? How did you find it learning and when did you really begin to accelerate in programming?
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

I guess you’ve learnt a lot in 2 months then? I have a 6 month old son so I don’t get much time to myself, hehe.

Read full topic
item.source: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today

item.title: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:7, topic:404721”][quote author=peterbjornx link=topic=501735.msg3671096#msg3671096 date=1310932287]
Self-taught, started off with GW-BASIC and Commodore-BASIC, then onto VB6, then i had C lessons (when i was 12), learnt Java from RSPS, started off just like all of you, copypasting tuts and shit, then i started reading better code to learn (ShardRevo) and i have a natural talent for recognizing patterns so thats why i understand the client so good, and ill get programming and CS at school next year (thats in 1.5month)
[/quote]

Wait so how old are you? when referring to school are you talking about college or highschool?

OT: I started with rsps about 2 years ago, still not too good with java. self taught my self a little bit of c#, then did a little scar/simba scripting but not much so i know very minimal amounts of pascal[/quote]
He’s like 16 or so. or at least that’s what his profile says.

I read that book in my signature, and I loved it so much I typed it out for everyone to read. Seriously though, I’ve been here for a year and a half approx. and I didn’t know anything about Java until about 2 months ago. I’ve just been lurking in the models section.

Read full topic
item.source: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today

item.title: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

Saphire`:

Open uni course M257. That’s the one I studied and thoroughly enjoyed.

Oh hey Kiera(e)n, I’m doing M255. I can’t wait.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming: How You Became What You Are Today
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

peterbjornx:

Self-taught, started off with GW-BASIC and Commodore-BASIC, then onto VB6, then i had C lessons (when i was 12), learnt Java from RSPS, started off just like all of you, copypasting tuts and shit, then i started reading better code to learn (ShardRevo) and i have a natural talent for recognizing patterns so thats why i understand the client so good, and ill get programming and CS at school next year (thats in 1.5month)

Wait so how old are you? when referring to school are you talking about college or highschool?

OT: I started with rsps about 2 years ago, still not too good with java. self taught my self a little bit of c#, then did a little scar/simba scripting but not much so i know very minimal amounts of pascal

Read full topic
